title: The Works of Robert Louis Stevenson - Swanston Edition, Vol. 16
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: Here,thinking of quite other things, I had stumbled on the solution orperhaps I should rather say (in stagewright phrase) the Curtain or finalTableau of a story conceived long before on the moors between Pitlochryand Strathardle, conceived in Highland rain, in the blend of the smellof heather and bog-plants, and with a mind full of the Atholecorrespondence and the memories of the dumlicide Justice.

title: The Works of Robert Louis Stevenson - Swanston Edition, Vol. 16
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: I love my nativeair, but it does not love me; and the end of this delightful period wasa cold, a fly-blister and a migration by Strathardle and Glenshee to theCastleton of Braemar.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: From Pitlochrie there is a road through Glen Briarachan, Strathardle, and Kirkmichael, to Spittal of Glenshee and Castleton  of Braemar.

title: The novels and tales of Robert Louis Stevenson.
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: Was there ever a more complete justification of the rule of Horace ? Here, thinking of quite other things, I had stumbled on the solution, or perhaps I should rather say (in stagewright phrase) the Curtain or final Tableau of a story conceived long before on the moors between Pitlochry and Strathardle, conceived in the Highland rain, in the blend of the smell of heather and bog-plants, and with a mind full of the Athole correspondence and the memories of the dumlicide Justice.

title: Essays of travel and in the art of writing,
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: Here, thinking of quite other things, I had stumbled on the solution, or perhaps I should rather say (in stagevk'right phrase) the Curtain or final Tableau of a story conceived long before on the moors between Pitlochry and Strathardle, conceived in the Highland  rain, in the blend of the smell of heather and bog-plants, and with a mind full of the Athole correspondence  and the memories of the dumlicide Justice.

title: Travels in Scotland: translated from the German. With notes by the translator [John Kesson]
author: Kohl, Johann Georg.
snippet: The oldest title of the family is " Baron Murray of Tullibardine," as generally in Scotland the baronial is shore ancient thanthe ducal title.* The other titles are as follows :—Earl ofTullihardine, Earl of Athol, Marquis of Athol, Viscount ofBalquhidder, Baron Murray, Balvenie, and Gask, Duke of Athol,Marquis of Tullihardine, Earl of Strathtay and Strathardle,Viscount of Glenalmond and Glenlyon.
